meanings.definition: The tendency to relapse into a previous condition or behavior.
meanings.sent1: Her recidivisms into unhealthy eating habits were hard to break.
meanings.sent2: The psychologist studied the recidivisms of patients struggling with addiction.
meanings.sent3: His recidivisms with procrastination led to a messy room.
meanings.sent4: The recidivisms of the old building's structural issues were costly to repair.
meanings.sent5: The recidivisms of the plant's wilting despite watering puzzled the gardener.

meanings.definition: The act of relapsing into criminal behavior.
meanings.sent1: The city implemented programs to reduce recidivisms among ex-convicts.
meanings.sent2: The judge warned the criminal about the consequences of recidivisms.
meanings.sent3: The recidivisms of the thief were predictable but frustrating for law enforcement.
meanings.sent4: The recidivisms of the pickpocket made him a familiar face to the police.
meanings.sent5: The recidivisms of the graffiti artist kept the neighborhood on edge.
